page.title: 02M.VERNON,DALDOWIE,BROOMHOUSE
page.content: { {MOUNT VERNON} is an exclusive owner-occupied housing estate,built on the site of Wester Farm.The residents commute to work.Sandyhills Golf Club is to the west and Carrick woods is to the north. {DALDOWIE HOUSE}was granted to James Woddrop of Dalmarnock by Cromwell in 1653.By 1724 it was mapped as Dalduy and owned by George Bogle.In 1830 it was owned by James McCall.The house is now demolished but the site is occupied by the crematorium, the regional nursery and the sewerage works. {BROOMHOUSE}was a toll gate on the 1775 road between Glasgow and Edinburgh. A housing estate now lies north of Hamilton Road. The villagers have a great sense of identity and community.
